definition: spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
shake/trembling

sentences.english: You might drink more later in the morning, to keep yourself energized.
sentences.chinese: 上午稍晚一點你會喝更多，爲了讓自己精神抖擻。

sentences.english: The man stepped off in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們精神抖擻地齊步走。

sentences.english: Lemonade on a hot day is very refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 在暑天喝檸檬水，會使人精神抖擻。

sentences.english: The horse perked up its head.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬精神抖擻地昂起頭來。

sentences.english: During the morning walk, I’m able to mentally prepare for my workday.
sentences.chinese: 當早晨散步時，我會精神抖擻地準備好工作的一天。

sentences.english: Do things that you inspire you daily.
sentences.chinese: 做那些能讓你每天精神抖擻的事。

sentences.english: The king got up and was surprised to see Nasreddin in high sprits.
sentences.chinese: 國王起牀後，看到納斯雷丁精神抖擻，就吃了一驚。

sentences.english: The goal setting process gets employees energized and excited.
sentences.chinese: 設定目標的過程要讓員工精神抖擻，興奮不已。

sentences.english: During the joy immediately like in a man in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 喜得李世民立即像是換了一個人一樣精神抖擻。
我的精神抖擻可讓你煩惱？

definition: full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
vitality/dynamism
full of vigor (idiom)/lively/in high spirits
full of vitality
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
elated/high-spirited/uplifting (music)
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
high-spirited/full of mettle
enthusiasm for doing sth
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
